attributes.action: note the distress caused to residents who live in the Fremantle care homes in the London  and to support the campaign being waged by Barnet UNISON against this appalling attack on already low paid workers; and calls on the Government to review employment law in relation to public service workers in the future".
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
UNISON the biggest trade union in the UK has members employed as residential and day care workers in the London borough of Barnet, who were transferred to the company “The Fremantle Trust ” under the Transfer of Undertakings (Protection of Employment) Regulations five years ago. 

Fremantle threatened to sack these employees on 1st April 2007 unless they sign new contracts worth 35 per cent less in pay, with reduced sick pay and holiday entitlement.

reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
